text: Bottle at Cantillon, split 3 ways with the wife and Mike (bytemesis), cheers! Pours a deep ruby/purple with a tiny off-white head. Very little lace. Aromas are vinous with wet oak, signature Cantillon funk, horse blanket, light musty basement, light hay. Taste is bold wine grapes (Carignan), very vinous, light acid, soft mouthfeel despite a lower carb. Lots of juicy grape notes, light sweet grape juice, light hay, light acid. Finishes juicy, lightly sweet, medium tart and medium dry brett. Delicious!

Bottle at Cantillon Brewery, Brussels. Red with pinkish head. The aroma has notes of red grapes, strawberry, yogurt and syrup. Sweetish and sourish flavor with notes of red grapes, strawberry, syrup and lemon. Soft carbonation, medium-bodied.

Bottle @ the brewery, shared with Tom; Thanks! Dark red colour, white foam. Nose of grapes, lots of berries, funk, basement. Taste is sweet juicy with lots of funk, lambic notes. Also rather bitter notes. Very well balanced. Very nice fruit gueuze.
Sporo eleganckiej słodyczy. Bardzo intensywne winogrona. Sporo ciała, delikatnie waniliowe. Eleganckie taniny, skóra. Znakomite.
Bottle at the brewery. Pink-red color with a pink head. Splendid aroma of grapes, funk and tropical fruits. Flavors of grapes, lemon, strawberries, oak. Medium-bodied, smooth. Great.
Bottle - Soft red fruit and light vinous notes. Bit of dried meat as well. Deep red with a decent white head. Vinous notes up front and nice red fruit. Acidic and nice.

Bottle at the brewery. Pours clear dark ruby with a white foam. Aroma is healthy funky with sweet grapes and some cherry. Body feels like a red wine with champagne carbonation: Medium, fizzy carbonation, fruity sweet grapes, clearly fermented. Lingering funky palate. Very, very good.

Bottle (750 m) at tasting. Massive thanks to Simon for sharing! Bright red with a small pinkish head, some retention, not leaving much lacing. Aroma is of red grapes, musty basement notes aplenty, mild mix of oak and grape spiciness, mineral notes and light acetic notes. Taste is of red grapes with musty basement, oak spiciness, borderline acetic notes, mineral notes and light herbalness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Moderately tannic mouthfeel. Red grapes finish. Thats another one which was a bit of a disappointment considering the great comments I heard about it but subpar bottles happens and we had one I guess. Much more cobweb/basement forward and musty than St. Lamvinus. Not much depth either.
Pours deep Cherry-red with 1mm carbonation. Aromas of pinot noir-grapes, sour cherries and stonefruit. Taste is sweet grapes, winey character with a long sour finish

14th March 201742nd Floor Bottleshare. Thanks to Dan, big thanks! Opaque blackcurrant colour beer, a few mauve bubbles for a head. Palate is smooth and semi dry and has reasonable fine carbonation. Rich red wine and modest oak. Just a little sourness. Red berries and wine skin tannins. Some darker berries on the finish. Amazing! Almost tastes like pure red wine. A rare Cantillon winner for me.

Bottle shared at the brewery. Pours a bright clear red with a pinkish head. Amazing full grape flavor, quite intense, still young, pretty funky already, raspberry, blackcurrant, hay, bit of a dry nutty taste. Medium sour, light sweet.

Bottle 750ml. shared at [ A Day To Sink All Sea Shepards tasting. ], Brussels, Belgium. [ As Cantillon Carignan ].Unclear matt medium red color with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy tart, berry - grapes - fruity, herbs, barnyard, funky, grapes - wine. Flavor is moderate sweet and light acidic with a average to long duration, wine, grapes, red wine, tart, dry, fynky, leather. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft to flat. [20160917]
 8-4-9-4-16
На дух не перенош& Бельгий& пиво,а это особенн& И вдобаво& самая хамская пивовар& из всех которые посещал& Просто мерзост&

Bottle shared at Cantillon. Beautiful hazy red with slightly offwhite pinkish head. Sweet raspberries and and red and white grapes. Soft red fruit, jelly, grain, cobwebs, wood, almonds. Light sweet, nutty bitter, tart but not sour. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very juicy texture.

March 2017 - 750ml bottle at Cantillon and again shared on L42. As Cantillon Carignan. Dark purple red, foamy pink head. Aroma is rich ribena, blackcurrant, lots of red wine. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste has more merlot red wine, some metallic notes, more blackcurrant and cranberry. Not too sweet. Tasty. With lower carbonation and a bit of air the sweetness rises and it develops more of an intense icepop/ribena and red wine flavour. (4.2)
Bottle, 750 ml at the brewery, shared with Miro. Pours deep red with white pinkish head. Fruity, lots of grapes, berries, bit vinous, funk, some wood, moderate carbonation. Medium bodied.

Bottle shared on Level 42 14/03/2017. Huge thanks to Daniel for this one. A hazed deep plum purple colour with a fine pink head. Aroma is big grape, cherry fruits, raspeberry, yogurt. Nice funk with a sharp edge. Flavour is composed of tart cherry and grape, funk, Red grape, raspberry. Palate is sour, tangy, woody oak tannin. . Good stuff.

Bottle shared in London / huge thanks to Daniel for the effort! Pours deep blood red with a small, creamy white head. Lovely aroma, lots of tart, dried berries, a little musty wood, grape, raspberry. Light sweet flavour with mellow acidity, more raspberry, tangy grapes, cherry, subtle woody dryness, soft funk. Light to medium bodied with spritzy carbonation. Fairly juicy in the finish, moderately acidic, with more drying wood, light alcohol, more jammy grapes, berries. Great stuff overall.
750ml bottle at the brewery. Pours out a pinkish red topped with a small head. Nose is nice berries grape barrel funk and som jammy sweetness. Taste is more of the house funk with a nice fruit blend.

Bottle at the source shared with Hoon the Chef. Hazy red color, pink head that settles quickly. Nice aroma of mixed berries. Taste is lightly tart berries, hefty tartness, some funky sourness. Our favorite of the session.

Bottle at the brewery. Pours a deep cranberry red with a good pink tinged head. Aroma has the red grape subtlety with the funky Cantillon aroma. Taste is really fruity and jammy up front with a mellow funk at the end with the tartness building right at the finish. Lovely soft carbonation. This is great stuff and probably the best beer Ive had from Cantillon.

2016 Bottle. Pours a deep ruby red with a fading light pink soft head. Aroma is of cranberry, dark grapes, red berries, tart. Taste is of red berries, grapes, buttery, acidic, light citrus and grassy notes, plums. Soft buttery mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2017 At Cantillon, 75 cl bottle from 2016. One of their recent grape lambic ventures, with thin, moussy, dirty pinkish white head leaving a stable rim, deep wine red colour with warmer ruby hue, hazy. Aroma of dry red wine and sweet blue grapes but also stewed plums, stale urine, grape pits, fermenting gooseberries, sweet tomatoes, moldy cellar, blackberry juice, fruit yoghurt. Vivid and rich fruity onset, lots of stewed stonefruit as well as red berries, sour with a thin lemony acidity but not harshly puckering, more soft lactic and fruit tartness, dry and juicy at the same time with a bready wheat backbone, drying finish with some musty cellar-like funk, grape pit oil and tannins, as well as a late, explicit, bit wry bitterness (probably a combination of earthy hops and grape tannins); at the same time, however, and old red wine- and sweeter grape juice-like brightness lingers. Funky but not overly so, sour but not puckering, juicy and dry all at once, this is yet another pretty Cantillon lambic, but perhaps a little bit subdued and less expressive than some others; I personally prefer Saint-Lamvinus slightly over this one. Nevertheless very interesting, glad I tasted it.

From notes. Enjoyed at Cantillon on November 10. 750 mL bottle, 2015 vintage shared with Kathleen. The pour is a nice deep ruby with a thin ring of egg shell colored head and no real lace to be found. The aroma is incredibly jammy. I love it. There is a Cantillon funk that is just lovely and a ton of fruitiness on the front end. The yeasty barnyard comes through on the back end, but this is a great balance. The flavor is just as good. The jamminess and the funk balance perfectly. There is a light tart wineyness that is delightful. The mouth feel is light and crisp with a great bright carbonation and a lingeringly dusty and fruity finish. This is just great. I like it a lot!
Birra lambic invecchiata in botte di vino rosso, succo id frutta, dolce-acida, rotonda, corposa

75cl bottle at the brewery, vintage 2015. Hazy dark red pour with a white-pinkish head. Notes of dank cellar, old wine barrel, sulphur, red grapes (both fresh and macerated), light vanilla, macerated cherries, cherry cores, light vinegar - amazing complexity on this beer. Surprisingly light body, medium carbonation and a tart and lightly sweet, cognac-barrel-like finish.

Botella @Cantillon Brewery/Museum, Bruselas 06/12/16 botella 2015
Color rojizo, aromas fruta, sabor dulce, agrio, frutas, cuerpo denso
Deep red coloured with a thin head. Lots of berries to the nose! Grapes and light funk. Taste is complex fruityness and lively berries. Amazing and I love it!

On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Rossa intensa, leggermente torbida, leggera schiuma rosa di buona persistenza. Al naso sentori di frutta rossa, ciliegia, uva, scorza di limone, bretta, note di botte. In bocca è morbidissima, vinosa, acidità leggera con residuo zuccherino, un po corta. Corpo medio, carbonazione leggera. Lambic di gran classe, ancora un po giovane, ma molto promettente!

Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Rome-Italy. Courtesy of Manuele, grazie! Happy birthday Macche. Incredible appearance. Purple cloudy bright color, the foam is dark pink similar to wine coming from the tank. Wow. Nose: vinous, yeasty, fruity. Complexity and superb elegance. Red fruit, Brett. Heaven. Mouth: soft and lovely. Heaven of lambic. Wine (soft), fruit again. Clean, crazy cleans and dry with a bit of tart. One of the best beers ever had in my all life!
Bottle at Cantillon. Pours red color, small white head. Aroma of currant, sourish. Taste is currant, hints of solvent, blueberries.
Bottle @ Cantillon. Pink, reddish pour with a generous head. Notes of tart grapes, apple skin, citrus, funk, some dusty mold, cheese and some grape juice. Delicious!

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2016 F: thin, almost none.
C: red, hazy.
A: red fruits, hint of acetone, woody, barnyard, vinous, complex.
T: red fruits, hint of sulphur, woody, very vinous fruity, barnyard, acetone, medium body, good carbonation, as it is the same bottle tasted at 7. November may be just the bottle was wrong as other rates are very good here, 7,5dcl bottle shared @ Cantillon in Brussels.

75cl bottle enjoyed at Cantillon. 2015 vintage with simple black and white label. It pours a rich dark purple color with a small pinkish head. Aroma is vinous with clear notes of red wine, wine must, lemon peel, red currants, light funk. Taste is also fruity, lightly sweet and funky, medium acidic and lightly spicy with notes of red currants, red wine, blackberries, touch of wood and lemon juice. The funky notes really come through as the bottle sits in its basket. Very complex beer. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, delicious, on par with the best batches of St Lamvinus and very similar flavour profile
Bottle at the brewery. Light acetone in both aroma and flavour, which partially degrades the experience of an otherwise fine fruity beer. Drinkable, but Cantillon can do much better.
Fľaa pivovar Cantillon, Brusel. Tmavo ruzova farba, slaba biela pena. Vona acetonu a laku na nechty, kyselkava, jemne ovocna. Chut kyselkava, trosku ovocna, aceton, syra. Nie moc ok.
Bottle at Cantillon. Red color with minimal tan head. Aroma of red grapes, sulphur, light acetone. Taste, sour red grape, acetone, bayrnard, earthy notes. Good, but without flaws it would be better.

2015 bottle with plain label shared at cantillon! Pours a slightly hazy pink with bubbly pink white head that dissipates to leave light lace. Aroma of musty funk, hint of lactic acidity, and mild grape must notes. Taste follows, funky grape notes with hints of acidity. Like all others from cantillon, really pleasant, super drinkable.

Bottle shared at the Brewery. Thanks Vincent! 2015 edition.  Fresh intense smooth sour nose. The beer starts sour and funky with lots of fresh fruit. The grapes are in the focus, sour but balanced round. Smooth intense fresh fruit, sour horse-blanket in the aftertaste. Fantastic balanced sour fruity grape aftertaste. Great!
Pours a pinkish red with a white around the rim lacing. Intense grape, cherry and berry notes. Stellar
October 2015 bottle enjoyed at the brewery in Sept 2016. Pours a radiant, blood red. Light funk aroma. Tastes like a light red wine, lightly carbonated. Very dry mouth feel. Easy to drink.

750 ml bottle shared at the original Chez Moeder Lambics cellar. Hazy red color with small pinkish head. Funky yeasty aroma, grapes, red wine, some fruity berry notes, wood. Light sweet and moderate acidic taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

2015 bottle, at the brewery. Hazy, slightly murky, darkish, copper red. Ring of head dissipates completely. Nose has old grape skin. Some woody, apple stalk. Notes of dried vine fruit. All backed up by that woody, vinous funk. Taste is vinous and lightly acidic. Pretty much bone dry. Cleansing mouthfeel. Light and crisp acidity. Finishes dry, vinous and lightly acidic. My cup of tea.

Slightly hazy ruby color with a bit of pinkish foam. Aroma is really fruity with cherry and cherry pit notes, not overly funky. Taste moves more towards red wine territory, fruity and tart, not very acidic, quite smooth body for a lambic. Really good one, tasty, balanced and quite easy to drink.

2014 750mL bottle, drunk 8/13/16.Brilliant, deep cherry-red body shows good clarity and a pink head that is well-retained.Earth, grapeskin, chalk (or very strong minerality, if you will) with great acidity showing both brett and lactic acids. Not "grapey", with the fruit nicely integrated and yet very bright, apparent and intense. Seems like a very good grape for lambic blending, having high acidity and also tons of subtle complexities. Light tannin, black pepper and more plastery minerality on the end with no alcohol or flaw.Tart acidity in the mouth shows lots of poignant red fruits; grape, raspberry, tart cherry and such. Light lactic acid mixes with very soft fruit juiciness to give a good sweet/sour element. Cherry, mint, pepper and grapeskin all balance the malt/wheat character nicely as tartness is well-controlled on the end, finishing with lip-smacking, tart, juiciness. Very unlike Cantillons other fruit lambics and it strikes me as still quite young, with the grape character, while enjoyable, still a bit forward and needing more time to meld with the lambic. No doubt this should be a knockout for years to come.

A 750ml bottle at the brewery. 2015 version bottled on 28th October 2015. Poured into a Cantillon tasting glass. It poured a slightly hazy purple-ish, grape red colour with a one finger pinkish head that settles to a thin layer with moderate lacing. Aromas were sour, tart, fruity, grape, cherry and strawberry. Taste was quite similar to the aroma with sour, tart, grape, cherry, strawberry, cranberry, raspberry and light funkiness. Light creaminess, light bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall this was excellent. It looks great, tastes great and was refreshing.
Bottle. Purple Ruby pour with white head. Full grape, tart and sweet, oak, and funky aromas. Flavors are grape, wine, oak and funk.
Bottle - pours purple pink head - nose and taste of grape funk, oak, musky red grape - medium body.

Bottle at Moeder Lambic, original. Pours a clearish warm red with a tiny hint of a head. Light smells of of sprucey resin. Tart with a very light sweetness. Soft and round compared to usual sharp tartness of Cantillon. Aromas of sour grapes and cherries with notes of red currant. Hints of a honey sweetness. Medium bodied with a full, slightly oily palate. Soft carbonation. Tart and bitter finish.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2016 Bottle shared with sunevdj at Moeder Lambic Original, 2015 version. Hazy deep red with a small white head. Juicy. Soft and thick texture with mild carbonation. Lemon, wood, must, red berries, vanilla. Soft and mellow.
Bottle at Cantillon. Pink color. Aroma has soft tart, tannine and red fruit. Taste of red grape, vanilla, oak tannine and lots of strong sourness. Special.

bottle @ Cantillon. Deep purple pour with a small head. Nose is really intense dark fruits. Blackberry and raspberry. Pepper. Earthy funk. Flavor is a bit sharp compared to most cantillon. Tart raspberry and red grape skin. Woody funk. Lemon. Acetic. Medium body, sharp carb. Solid.

September 3, 2015. Bottle at Cantillon, Bottled november 14, 2014. 
Clear ruby red with a small off-white head. Aroma is fruity, light funky and vinous with lemon juice, grape skins, cherry oak, minerals, some hay and earthy notes. Taste is sour with a very light fruity sweetness, light funky. Finish is dry vinous grape skins, oak, hay, minerals, sour green apple and lemon notes. Medium bodied, average carbonation. 
Very nice, refreshing with a quite vinous dry finish.
Fra bryggeriet duft frisk sød rød frugt frisk sød, sødlig frisk rødebær smag rød smag frisk sødlig kirsebær hindbær

Bottle at the brewery, Pours a brilliant deep rubine red color with a light tan/pink head. The smell is rich red grapes, mild must, some fruit sweetness at the base. The taste is juicy grape, nicely balanced by a tart/sourness. Very nice and drinkable. Light+ in body with tight carbonation. A great beer!

750 at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Served in a basket. Beautiful red hue with a pink head. Tart red wine aroma. Med + body. Flavor is tart red berry. The red wine type berry is strong. It is so smooth. It is so delicious.

Bottle at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Poured from a basket with great care. Pours ruby with an attractive pinkish head and a magnificent grape aroma. There is a very delicate smooth moderately sor grape flavor with a huge yeast presence and a tart finish. Wow!

Bottle at the Cantillon tasting room. Nice deep red with a pale head. Aroma is red wine, port, red currants, strawberry yoghurt. Light-medium bodied, complex on the palate, long fruity finish. Taste is forest berries, fruity red wine, oak, strawberry yoghurt.

Bottle shared at Quintessence 2016. Pours beautiful reddish pink. Aroma is grapes, raspberries, funk, citrusy and some wood. Taste is moderate sour and light sweet. Very dry. Love this. Super drinkable while retaining a lot of flavour. Long dry finish.
Spritzig traubiger Antrunk. Geringe Säure, würzig. Deutlich fruchtig, minimal herb, mittellanger Nachhall. Nett. 9/9/8/9//9

Sampled at Mder Lambic & Quintessence back to back, truly an amazing jammy experience. Aroma is reminiscent of DQ, minus the Welches® note.
Taste is sweeter than the St. Lam tried at the same time, color is less translucent. One of the more memorable specific grape lambics.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2016 Carignan Récolte 2015, bottled 28 Oct 2015. 75cl bottle shared at source 2016-IV with Oedipus Sander et al. - - Bref: red wine tannins, grape sulphurs and some acids supplant more than complement Cantillons trademark bone-dry funk and complexity in this young Lamvinus variation. Beautiful deep pink-mauve pour, fata morgana bubbles. Young wine must, young small red grape juice prickle and mildly funky lemon juice in aroma translates into thinned out Merlot-ish young must in taste. Sharper edges, juicy and still elegant. Preferred the hazier, silkier Lambic dAunis from the wicker basket next to it.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl à Anderlecht chez Cantillon.
Couleur rouge sang, petite mousse et petite effervescence.
Nez sur le lambic
Attaque que le lambic, le raisin, très longue bouche sur la continuité acide et sur les tanins du vin !

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 Bottle at the brewery, April 2016. Deep purple color with small head. Aroma is vineous, funky, slightly peppery. Taste is extremely mellow, grapey, peppery towards the end. Jammy mouthfeel. Ticklish carbonation. A lambic masterpiece.
2016 bottle at the brewery, Feb 2017. Just as good as I remember it.

How: Bottle.
Where: Akkurat, Stockholm.
Appearance: Ruby colour with a pinkish off-white head.
Aroma: Sour, fruit, citrus, vinous, grapes.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Sour, fruit, vinous, grapes, citrus.
Hay, oaky, dry grape. Quite a bit drier than most other Cantillons with grape. Fresh, young. Needs a little time to soften for me.

Bottle at Brasserie Cantillon Brouwerij, march 16th 2015. Hazy ruby body, white lacings. Aroma is funky and oaky, forest and wild berries. Taste is sour with red wine, quite bitter, fruity and funky, with a strong barnyard note. Crisp lactic finish, quite a cool Cantillon.

Bottle shared with kermis at the brewery. 
Thin white ring head. Hazy burgundy pour. Tart cherry aftertaste.

Bordeux red colour. Thin round of white froth. Berries, hints of horseblanket in the aroma. A bit of acidity. Cherries, raspberries, hints of cranberries. Red wine in the end. Nice and long mouthfeel. Light bodied, refreshing, gorgiously balanced.
Really a big fan of this one. Has the grape juice thing going on like DQ; complex and balanced with the sweetness and the lambic backbone. Glad to make it to Akkurat for this one.

Bottle at Akkurat, Stockholm. Hazy reddish amber beer with a small but lasting offwhite head. Sourish fruity aroma, grapes, citrus, rubber, fruity notes, some vinous notes. Sour fruity flavor, grapes, citrus, woody, rubber, cherries, funky, hay notes, cherry seeds, apricot notes. Amazing, complex and with crazy good sourness. We have a new love in town!

Pour from bottle at Cantillon early August 2015, compliments of Jean van Roy. Thank you! Foggy royal red color with purple tints and a small, light pink head. Nose and flavor hold extraordinarily rich sweet juicy plum, vinous tannin, grape must, cobweb, and wood. Beautifully light acidity, soft carbonation. Like a juicier and more elegant St. Lamvinus. Absurdly good.
Bottle @ Cantillon 15/5-15. Fruity and bretty with grapes, also acidic. Dry finish.

Bottle at Akkurat. Hazy pink with a little bit of pinkish head. Funky aroma with smooth vinous notes, raspberry, cranberry and a hint of stable. Velvet smooth vinous taste with grapes, cranberry, raspberry and some dry oaky notes. Light stable/barnyardy finish. Overall very well balanced.

Bottle (2014) at Cantillon. Pours a beautiful hazy red with a fizzy, pink head. Aroma is very funky, almost acetonic. Is almost vinous like natural wine, champagne, red grapes, pinot noir, leather tannins. Taste is sour, funky and dry, but with a juicy, nice fruityness to it. High carbonation and an oily, acidic texture. Excellent! Complex and drinkable at the same time.
75 cl bottle at Akkurat. Pours cloudy amber, no head. Aroma is smooth wineous. Mellow fruity. Leathery, fruity, barnyard. Smooth fruity and dry leathery finish. Mellow finish.

75cl bottle at Cantillon. Warm red pink colour Hazy lasting white pink head. Aroma of red wine. Rhone red fruits. Raspberry strawberry cherry then dry as hell. Some sweet fruit and alcohol then dry as a dusty dry dessert that hasnt rained in years. Beautiful.

My Bottom Line:
Flowers drape grapes in this citric, funky Fruit Lambic.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam decorates the dark pink.
-A very slight pediococcus viscosity had begun to take hold of this bottle.
-The aroma is bright and engaging.
-Acidity is high, but not too intense.
-Drinkability is very high.

Bottle.
@ Cantillon 15-10-30: Lätt och frisk bärighet. Lätt kolsyrad smak av bär och vindruvor med en aning fattorrhet. Ganska snäll syrlighet men mycket gott.
Bottle at Cantillon. Hazy dark red with a small head. Vinous with red grapes, oak, funk and light cheese. Elegant and nicely balanced. Not that tart.

Bottle @ Cantillon. Pours hazy dark red with a medium punk head. God damn, this looks good! Aroma has such a deep vinous character, tannins, oak, funk, cheese, stable notes, jam. Taste is vinous, red grapes, funky, tart, jammy, tannic, cheesy, hay and dry tart finish. Probably my favorite from Cantillon ever. God damn this is good.

Bottle at Cantillon, Brussel. Aroma of ripe grapes, red fruits, tart cherries, oak, barnyard funk. Flavour is nicely sour with a hint of red fruity sweetness. Finish is dry. Body is medium, rich and tasty. Another gorgeously balanced and refined beer from Cantillon.
Bottle @ Cantillon. Pours hazy pinkish with a white head. Merlot, kriekencherries, funk, wood and fruit. Extremely soft and juicy with quite some wood and a tart dry finish. Lovely.

A very fruity one. Aroma of horse blanket, cherries, red currants, with a big grape quality to it. Clear mineral taste with a bit saltiness, a bit back on the funk, overripe grapes, quite rich grape flavour with plenty tannins and oak quality, a nice tart finish.

Bottle split at the brewery with JF, 24/09/15.
Rich cherry red with a decent crimson covering. 
Nose is tarte cherry, straw, wood must, tangy pink berry, light manure.
Taste comprises bitter cherry skins, wood must, funk, barnyard, tangy red berry, earthy linger. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with light acidic tones.
Solid berry Lambic.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at Cantillon. Pours really hazy red, with a white head. Aroma of cheese, sesame seeds, acidity, red berries. Taste is cheese, sesame seeds, fruits, red berries, not as tart as expected, dry wood.
Bottle @ Cantillon. Hazy red body with a small pink head. Yeast, funk, cherry notes, tartness, grapes, fruity. Very well balanced. Delicious.

Bottle at Cantillon. Pours pink with little pinkish head. Aroma of sesam, light cheese, tarty, sour, red currents, dusty, earth. grapes. Quite complex, tho some mild flaws of sesam. Still very nice experience.
[9/18/15] Bottle at the brewery in Brussels. Lovely deep red color. Great aroma full of barnyard, grapes, oak. Sour flavor, funky, oaky, with grapes and citrus. Medium-bodied. Great stuff.

Bottle at the source with Al Barry and Keith. Pours ruby red with thin white head. Notes are sour and vinous grapes, a touch of rust, spice, horseblanket, vtg cheese and oak. Lighter bodied. Sourness is average. A little fresh tasting for me but still very nice juice.
Mooi roze rode kleur met een mooie roze schuim kraag. Ruikt fruitig, druiven, zuur. Smaakt ook zo.

Bottle at the brewery. Pours a nice red with a pinkish head. Aroma is deep and vinous with notes of grapes, tannins, nice deep oakyness and some funk. Also some weak marzipan, leather and cheese. The taste is vinous and rather fruity with those grapefruits up front. Also some cheese, leather, tannins and funk. It is sour but at the same time gentle and also very complex. Definitely one of my favorites from Cantillon. Amazing stuff!

Bottle at Cantillon.

Great colour, grapes are prominent. I think this will age well will be nice to see in the future.

bottle at the brewery
pours inviting deep crismon, with winey woody notes alongside typical lambic character on the nose. Full bodied, quite grapey, jars a bit against the lambic, fruity, sharp, bretty, earthy, stables.
From a bottle at the brewery. Clear ruby, medium pinkish head. Cidry aroma with dark berries and grapes, some rural notes. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium acidity.

Bottle at the brewery. Hazy deep red, with a small pink head. Aroma of oak, funk, grapes, black currant and cherry. The flavour is fruity sweet, and definitely also tart, but appears rather mild, balanced and drinkable compared to some other fruit Cantillons. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2016 Bottle at Cantillon - shared with Mette. Clear deep red - light pink head. 
Nice red grape. Earthy. Fruity. Dryness. Light marzipan. Stones. Light spycy peppery. Grape zesty. Light soapy. Light light soapy. High dry and spicy peppery finish.... ReRate as: Cantillon - Carignan Recolte 2015. Bottle at Cantillon - shared with Mette. Clear deep red - white head. Red grapes red berries. Strawberries. Raspberries. Light sourness. Some notes of marzipan. Light spicy. Funky. Fresh. Light peppery. Lovely.

Bottle at the brewery. Light pink-purple body with pinkish head. Aromas of red wine, with oak, berries and vinegar in the background. Taste is a bit acidic and harsh for me, while others seem to love it. Main tastes are wine, fermented wheat, vinegar, wood. Finishes dry. Good but not great.
Bottle at Cantillon. Poured slightly hazy burgundy red with pink head. Aroma red wine, grapes skin cherry lacto. Light carb med bod. Tastes min sour tart cherry red wine, not as funky as aroma.

Bottle at Cantillon. Almost clear deep red burgundy color with thin white head, quite winey. Aroma is winey, lots of cherry pits, grape skin, quite winey. Taste is surprisingly sweet, juicy, nice winey notes, tastes quite young, funk is quite mild.

Bottle shared with Thompson and brother J @ Cantillon. Nice clear dark red color, medium sized pinkish head. Aroma is barnyard, horseblanket lightly, nice fruity notes. Taste is superbly balanced fruit, fruitpeel, fruitpeel sour, vinous. A bit dry finish, soft velvety mouthfeel. Superb.

Bottle at Cantillon. Pours somewhat hazy ruby with purple hints and a small, fizzy pink head, short retention with spare lacing. Aroma is earthy and cellared grapes and wet, near moldy oak with soft pale malt and a lingering acidity. Flavor is tart and acidic grapes, light pale malt, wet oak, cellar notes, and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Reddish amber colour, small pink head. aroma is almost bakingyeast like with some floral and wooden notes to it. Flavour is dry fruitiness, some wood, sourness and mild yeasty notes. Smooth Cantillon and apart from the baking yeasty notes, top notch.
Bottle at cantillon. Pours deep ruby, nose is toffee, oak, grapes, taste is dry, tart fruit, light sweetness
Bottle at the brewery. Nice musty grape smell. Dry and fruity. Light sourness. Bit of barrel in there. Feels full bodied. Gets richer further down. Nice

(750ml bottle @ Cantillon brewery, July 25 2015) Pours nearly clear medium red link with a small whitish head fading to a ring. Nose has red wine notes of strawberry, other berries mixed in, herbal/floral garrigue, old hops, attic, moderate vinous acidity. Bright and fruity overall. Palate has a similar basic character, sprightly vinousness of a Beaujolais paired with the tannic grip of a Cote du Rhone. Strawberry again features. Grape skin from the middle on. Herbs, wood, dusty attic, light Brett dry it out towards the finish. Pretty big tannic bite on the finish, slightly medicinal, probably from old hops. Softly carbonated and really smooth. This is super elegant, juicy even, really quite tasty. If theres one thing it might be missing, its a little edge. Still wonderful.

Bottle shared with northropfrye and cards at Cantillon in Brussels . Dec 2012 bottled Nov 2014. I rated the aroma very high pm sour grapes. Appearance is ruby red, beautiful . Palate is incredibly smooth. Taste of sour grapes , touch of celery/green pepper. So smooth . I thought I didnt like Cantillon buy now I changed my mind . So good .

Beautiful beer. Rich raspberry bod pink head, looks like a bottle of wine. Amazing aroma of red wine , vinegar , oak, nuttiness , sour cherries. Taste is perfect creamy soir, not harsh, so fucking smooth , lactose. Coating dry palstr, sucks the moisture out of your mouth. Bottle at Moeder Lambic in Brussels. Amazing beer.

This is a life changing beer. Pours a beautiful deep raspberry red. Aromas of earthy funk, sugary grapes, merlot, oak. Flavours are so Damn smooth. Easily the smoothest lambic Ive ever had. Merlot and grapes, notes of green pepper and wood. Raspberry flavours as well. Carbonated and fucking smooth. This is the real deal.

Bottle: Taster:
Thin white pink head. Cloudy red ish beer. Looks good.
Aroma is like the flavour a bit softer than most other cantillons.
Some typical Cantillon funk, wild yeast, wood, fruit like red fruity tones, some berries and citrussy tints.
Flavour is more bitter than i am used of Cantillon. Light tart, fruity, bitter, wood, cellar, light dry, flowers, some red fruit and berries, very tasty and nothing too crazy which makes it quite smooth.
Aftertaste is light dry, funky, fruity, light woody and a hint of some flowers.
Low carbo, light creamy light dry mouthfeel, more than just medium bodied.
Pretty soft and smooth.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Dégustée en compagnie de Joey à la brasserie. Cheers my friend! La bière est rouge, mousseuse et translucide. On pourrait facilement croire quil sagit dune Kriek. Arômes vineuses mais majoritairement fruitées. Je sens de la framboise, du raisin rouge et de la framboise. En bouche le côté acide du lambic est bien présent mais parfaitement balancé par laspect très vineux de la bière - beaucoup plus présent en bouche quau nez. Cest très pétillant, chaud et même un peu alcoolisé (pour les faibles 5% quelle tire). Magnifique bière dapéritif!

75 cl bottle @ the brewpub. Bottled 4.11.2014 Aroma has earthy notes, tart berry juice and grapefruit. Flavour has earthy notes, mild tartness, berry juice and mild spiciness. Also cherries and mild lactic notes. Becomes somewhat acidic after some sips. Aroma was somewhat aggressive but flavour is rather mellow for a Cantillon.

Bottle at Cantillon in Brussels. Pours deep Purply Red with a short White head. Aroma of fresh grape giving way to a more wine-like character. Plenty of funk and tartness to go around. Nice woody character makes it come alive in a more winey fashion. Heavy sourness and an easy going fizz. Really interesting and totally delicious.

Bottle at the source. Almost clear deep ruby liquid with small to medium light pink head. Aroma of lemon, grapes, wood, light earth and light mineral. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with notes of light lemon, apple skin, light wood and red grapes. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Nice and complex. Great color.

Bottle @ Cantillon, shared among new and old friends. Pours clear ruby, small white/pink head that dissipates with decent lacing. Aroma is funky, lots of grape notes, oak. Flavor is dry, medium funky, barnyard, a fair amount of cheese, light tartness, grapes and oak tannins. Light body, low carbonation. Quite good.

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur rouge pâle voilé, mousse légèrement rosée. Arôme de raison, vin rouge, boisé, levure sauvage. Goût fruité, raisin, acidité moyenne, légère astringence, vineux en fin de bouche. Carbonatation moyenne-faible, corps moyen.

Bottle at Cantillon. Pours a hazy reddish color with off-white head. Aroma like Pinot noir wine with funk and tartness on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with more lingering Pinot noir like notes, tart and dry.

Bottle on train from Brussels to Cologne, 3rd June 15. Pours a beautiful crimson red, few bubbles. Aroma is vineous fruit, slight cherry. Taste is funky, tart grape, some straw, bitter apple, slight barnyard. Not overly sour, light and well balanced. Very refreshing and complex, with the typical Cantillon base coming through. Excellent

Clear red crimson colour, slight pinkish white head. Fruity aroma, grapes, grape skin, red wine notes, light barn, slight lactic sourish / yoghurt hint. Nice, fruity flavour, red grapes, soft wine, slightly sweet red fruits, light sour, very fruity. Fruity finish, red grapes, gentle red wine, some straw, citrus and barnyard. Nice!(from 75cL bottle @ the brewery. Shared with an American couple on honeymoon to enhance the experience)

Carignan 14 vintage

Pours a ruby, saturated red color, with a decent fizzy head.

Smells incredible wine forward, with fermented grapes, horse blanket and a tartness of fermented red grapes. Almost got a whiff of cherries to it, resulting from earthy, slighty sweeter stone qualities.

Has a fitting medium carbonation, with a tart refreshing mouthfeel.

Tastes of tart, young grapes among earthy, dusty malts, while the acidic sourness hovers shamelessly above anything else. Dont got much body to it, while its fermented, vinous flavors convince on their own. Finishes with ripe grape qualities, integrating a gentle counterpoint to the tartness by adding a sweet fruit note to the taste. 

Overall the beer compensates its lack of depth beautifully by the very convincing, well pronounced red grape appearance. This comes as close to wine as I have experienced so far in a beer, while the grape flavor is defined by a wild sourness, without adding much else. Creates an unusual straight forward lambic, with the typical Cantillon Lambic foundation.

Bottle at Cantillon. Slight hazy ruby with small pink head. The deep red/pink color is absolutely gorgeous. Some light grapes up front, followed by red berries, raspberry, cassis. After the initial fruitiness theres quite some hay, funk, old wood and drying grass. Light sour with medium bitter finish. Light bodied with sparkling carbonation. A treat!

slight pinkish head. scarlet colour. aroma is funky, wood, red fruits, cherries, raspberry, grapes. taste like aroma, balsamico, very fruity with a great sweet-sour balance. quite dense mouthfeel, medium carbonation, dry mouthfeel. what a balance and so much flavour and complexity. marvelous. thank you cantillon for this treat! bottle 75cl @ cantillon / bd nov-2014
Bottle (750 ml) @ Cantillon 150515. Fruity and vinous with light bretty notes and grapes, medium body with a watery texture. The finish is tart and fruity.

Bottle purchased at Cantillon. Sampled side by side with both St. Lamvinus and Pineau DAunis. Pours a deep red bordering purple in color with a light whitish pink ring of foam around the glass. Jammy nose, some cherry, dusty, much more fruit forward than funkiness, some pepper. Nose is reminiscent of a fruitier red wine along the lines of a young pinot noir. Taste is red grape with some hints of black cherry, very vinous, dry yet fruity. Light, delicate mouthfeel, gentle acidity, definitely on the dryer side when compared to the other two. another stunning grape lambic from Cantillon. While this had a lot of similarities to Lamvinus, I found Lamvinus to be much fruitier and not nearly as dry as Carignan. This reminded me a lot more of a real red wine. Spectacular beer.

Bottle pour at the source. The beer pours a dark red with decent clarity and a pink head of foam. The aroma is grapy and earthy with a big juicy tartness. There is a nice berry and grape presence in the taste behind that delicious sourness. Moderate carbonation. So good!
Bottle at Cantillon - Pours red. Grapes, earthy, tart nose. Dry grapes, lemon zest, tart and acidic.

14 Euro on-site @ Cantillon the day before Toer de Gueuze 2015. Split 2 ways with some pours shared with strangers as they inquired of the bottle. 

A - Appearance is a blood red. 1 finger muted pink head with tight bubbles.

S - Smells incredibly vine-forward. Lots of juicy grape. A slight hint of balsamic vinegar. 

T - Vinegar forward with pears and grapes and apple. Very musk-like. Chalky finish. Side by side with Pineau and its just not in the same league.

M - Solid mouthfeel but not as mature as other bottles with similar bottling dates. Needs a bit more OOMPH.

O - This was great to try (just like all Lambic) but I wasnt a fan of it. Will revisit in a few months and update notes if my impression changes.

Dark red cloudy pour. A lasting light pink head. Light berry flavours and some red burgundy tendencies, strawberry, raspberry and wet rock. ballanced; no one flavour dominates but leaning towards crisp pinot noir. Aftertaste is mineral and very bourgogne rouge now woth a light carbonation and ultra smooth mouthfeel. Very good!

Bottle at Cantillon. Deep opaque garnet pour with a pinkish head. Mild vinous aromas. Sweeter and smoother than Pineau d Aunis. Sweet Merlot or Pinot Noir vinous highlights. Sweet grape and malty backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel.

Bottle at Cantillon. It pours cloudy deep purple with a small white head. The nose is balsamic vinegar, wood, light vanilla, grape skin, red apple, funk, musty stuff and damp leaves. The taste is rather mellow, smooth, juicy red grape, light pepper, good mouth-pucker, tart green apple, plum skin, lemon sherbet, funk, mild acidity and damp wood with a lightly dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Really rather juicy and mellow. Tasty stuff.

Bottle to glass at the brewery. Pours a mostly clear beautiful rose color with little to no head. Aroma is sweet and sour grape juice. Mild tartness in the flavor with a well balanced grape sweetness. Touch of funk. Excellent beer. Imagine this would age very well.

Bottle at Cantillon Brewery.
Appearance: Red, deep pinkm light pink minimal head, slightly hazy
Aroma: Grape juice and cellar
Taste: Grape, earth, balanced oriental spices and black pepper, slightly swwet.
Balanced finish

Bottle at the brewery. 
Pours deep red with a small pink head
Quite sweet Taste of blod oranges, red grapes and lambic. Rather smooth mouthfeel

At cantillon 75 bottle. 

The aroma of the beer had many different aromas but there were mostly a unripe "greenness", Green unripe fruits and foliage of carrot and/or beetroot was there and danced around in the nose. Also the smell of the spice "aromat" was present. 

A slight taste of rubber band that disappeared after a while when the heat of the glass steps. one could find some wild strawberries and much violets in the aftertaste. The beer tasted most out of strawberry caramel, or rather toffe with strawberry flavor. Spicy artificial cherries were also there in the backround taste
Pours deep red, ok white head. Smell is grapes, with the cantillon funk. Taste is intense, very intense grapes. Peppery indeed, bit earthy even. Intense sourness, yet very balanced. Yummie stuff!

Bottle at brewery. Wonderful appearance with a red pinkish color. Aroma is yet a little limitied in its complexity and I think it will mature over time. Grape skins, wild strawberries and a variety of spices. Musty. Mouthfeel is interrsting and the flavors are messing with you. Musty grape skins and dark grapes then wild strawberries, strawberry candy and tart red wine. Ends tart. Lots of potential in this one.

Bottle at the brewery. Pours hazy red purple with a pink head. Aroma of tart grapes, funky, dank cellar notes and a touch of citrus. Flavor is moderate acidic with a super soft and balanced palate with a dry finish. Probably the most accessible of the wine grape lambics. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at the brewery and once again thx to Jean and Mathieu!
APPEARANCE: clear red beer, small stable reddish head.
NOSE: tart, fruity, very sour, oak, red grapes.
TASTE: very dry, grapes, hay and barnyard like, dry hopped? Nice, but I have other Cantillon favorites ^^

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2015 Bottle at Cantillon. Gorgeous red with a pink head. Very fruity nose, cherries, vinous. Taste is grapes, quite sweet for a Cantillon, some grapepeel that make it quite bitter. Together with 50N42E this must be my favourite Cantillon. Its phenomenal.

Editted score after trying again together with Lou Pepe Framboise. Figured out I like Lou Pepe more.

bottle shared at the brewery with a friend. bottled at november 2014. poured a clear deep dark red colour leaving a nice pink-ish head on top! weve had this one right after the pinot dáunis. this one is way more fruity in the nose! aroma of a more sour grape, funky acid, casis, oak, grapes, very complex and a lot fruit forward! incredible rich mouthfeel, with layers of fruit perfectly combined with sour tart lambic notes. more hints of oak, some vanilla, bit of yeast, horseblanket, citrus, bitter grapeskin, nice tart finish. still nice carbonated. this is one incredible experience! im always more of a fan of lamvinus compared to fou foune. but this one beats a vintage lamvinus after one sip. I would love to have this more regular! ive had a hard time to give this one a score that it deserves. but this was just the best fruit lambic ive had! incredible!

Disparate pink head over cyclamen-red beer, hazy. Red fruit - Id rather have said sour cherry than red grape, but it does smell a tad vinous. Some faint, fresh green herb; old wood. Very vinous, red wine, hints at sweetness (!) midst all the fruit- and lactic sourness. Grapeskin flavours, prominent. Wild lambicyeasts, yet quite mild - superb!! Again a strange leafy fruit in the aftertaste. Light, overattenuated body, quite a bit spritzy. WOW! This is an absolute topper, even to Cantillon standards.  Many, MANY thanks to the Vermeersch bros!

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2015 Bouteille 75cl @ Cantillon, embouteillée en Nov. 2014, lambic de Dec. 2012? 2 ans dage venant du lot P19.
De couleur rougeâtre voire acajou, un col rosâtre effervescent retombant rapidement.
Arôme met de suite laccent sur un cépage fruité aux notes assez tenaces. Ce bouquet me rappel un peu le profil du Pineau dAunis lorsque cette dernière était encore fort jeune. Les senteurs sont agréables chargées en fruité de raisin avec un rétro-nasal portant les notes habituelles dun lambic Cantillon. Retrouve une senteur légèrement boisée avec une petite note de tanin, léger funk. Ici, le raisin brille par sa complexité.
Palais sur une effervescence moyenne voire haute. Le profil est également fortement centré sur le fruité, le tout étant sec, finement acidulé et plus suret. Le cépage donne une certaine profondeur au corps avec une composante vineuse qui y ajoute un caractère appréciable. On note quasiment ce côté fruit entier avec un caractère de peau tannique de ce raisin. Lambic forcément encore dans sa jeunesse et dont les vertus acidulées seront intéressantes à déguster - si les bouteilles ne se vendent pas avant. Il me hâte de voir ce que Jean a dans ses recettes avec dautres cépages, notamment des vignobles italiens ou croates.

750 ml. bottle @ brewery. Labeled & commercially sold. Same type of yellow label as the recent Pinot dAnuis bottles. This beer came appeared out of nothing for me. Bottle says lambiek December 2012. Bottled November 2014. It is carbonated. Apparently this one uses Carignan grapes from Mas dAgalis in South of France. Pours a very deep dark ruby red, ruby red grapes, head is deep pink at first but quickly vanishes to only some bubbles on the side of the glass. Nose is huge tannic very dry red grapes, some fruit sweetness, light mineral quality, touch vinous alcohol, cranberries jam, lots of very dry oak. Taste is lots of very dry oak in a real wine forward way followed by Cantillon funk, dry cork, tannic very dry red grapes, grape skins, tannic wine, huge amount of oak, lots of very red grapes combined with Cantillon funk. Extremely dry, oak-forward & very red wine forward. Typical lively but not overtly so Cantillon carbonation. Out of all the Cantillon wine experiments I have had, this one is by far the most wine-like. I cannot expect any beer to come closer to being a lambiek & wine hybrid in terms of flavor. It has such typical very dry oak wine qualities combined with very wine-like tannic dry grapes & Cantillon funk. For anyone equally into wine & lambiek this must be heaven. Fresh already this beats Saint Lamvinus at its own game, Saint Lamvinus astronomically improves at 2 years old in my opinion. Bonus points for the shear success of the experiment.
